meanings.definition: One who speaks or performs without preparation
meanings.sent1: The extemporizer impressed everyone with their spontaneous speech.
meanings.sent2: The extemporizer on stage captivated the audience with their improvisation.
meanings.sent3: The extemporizer at the party had everyone laughing with their impromptu jokes.
meanings.sent4: She was an extemporizer, effortlessly weaving stories on the spot.
meanings.sent5: The extemporizer's ability to entertain without planning was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: To speak or perform without preparation
meanings.sent1: He had to extemporize a speech when the teleprompter failed.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to extemporize beautifully during live performances.
meanings.sent3: The comedian had to extemporize a response to the unexpected heckler.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, leaders must often extemporize solutions quickly.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to extemporize his lines when he forgot the script.
